basejump

Generate gene2symbol from GFF/GTF File

Generate gene2symbol from GFF/GTF File

gene2symbolFromGFF(object, ...)

gene2symbolFromGTF(...)

# S4 method for character
gene2symbolFromGFF(object, quiet = FALSE)

# S4 method for data.frame
gene2symbolFromGFF(object, quiet = FALSE)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments (for the S4 generic definition).
quiet

If TRUE, suppress any status messages and/or progress bars.

Value

data.frame.

Details

The GFF (General Feature Format) format consists of one line per feature, each containing 9 columns of data, plus optional track definition lines. The GTF (General Transfer Format) is identical to GFF version 2.

See also

Other Gene Annotation Utilities: annotable, detectOrganism, gene2symbol, symbol2gene, tx2geneFromGFF, tx2gene

Examples

# From URL (recommended)
url <- "http://basejump.seq.cloud/mmusculus.gtf"
gene2symbolFromGFF(url) %>% str()
#> Reading GFF/GTF: mmusculus.gtf
#> gene2symbol mappings: 17 genes
#> 'data.frame':	17 obs. of  2 variables:
#>  $ ensgene: chr  "ENSMUSG00000025900" "ENSMUSG00000051951" "ENSMUSG00000064842" "ENSMUSG00000088333" ...
#>  $ symbol : chr  "Rp1" "Xkr4" "Gm26206" "Gm27396" ...

# GFF data.frame
gff <- readGFF(url)
#> Reading GFF/GTF: mmusculus.gtf
gene2symbolFromGFF(gff) %>% str()
#> gene2symbol mappings: 17 genes
#> 'data.frame':	17 obs. of  2 variables:
#>  $ ensgene: chr  "ENSMUSG00000025900" "ENSMUSG00000051951" "ENSMUSG00000064842" "ENSMUSG00000088333" ...
#>  $ symbol : chr  "Rp1" "Xkr4" "Gm26206" "Gm27396" ...
